Description: Copper alloy animal coffin, relic-box, rectangular, surmounted by snake coiled into figure of eight, details of eyes and scales incised, one end of coffin open, base damaged, front end inscribed with invocation of Atum on behalf of one Psamtek son of Padiamun and Djedhapiusankh.
Curator's comments: Published: Art and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt (Japan 1999-2000): No 152
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1986 Jun-Oct, Carmarthen Museum, A son of Luxor's Sands 2001 26 Jun-23 Sep, Birmingham Gas Hall, Egypt Revealed
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Atum (as snake)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
